la.decomposition

Class SingularValueDecomposition

  • java.lang.Object
    • la.decomposition.SingularValueDecomposition

  • public class SingularValueDecomposition
extends java.lang.Object
    A Java implementation for the singular value decomposition of a general m-by-n matrix.

    The input matrix is first reduced to bidiagonal matrix and then is diagonalized by hybrid of standard implicit shifted QR algorithm and implicit zero-shift QR algorithm. All the singular values are computed to high relative accuracy independent of their magnitudes.

    Version:
    1.0 Dec. 12th, 2013
    Author:
    Mingjie Qian

      • quickSort

        private static void quickSort(double[] s,
             double[][] Ut,
             double[][] Vt,
             int start,
             int end,
             java.lang.String order,
             boolean computeUV)
        Sort the singular values in a specified order. If computeUV is true, left and right singular vectors will also be sorted.
        Parameters:
        s - a 1D double array containing the singular values
        Ut - left singular vectors
        Vt - right singular vectors
        start - start index (inclusive)
        end - end index (inclusive)
        order - a String either "descend" or "ascend"
        computeUV - if U and V are to be computed

      • standardShiftedQR

        private static void standardShiftedQR(double[] s,
                     double[] e,
                     double[][] Ut,
                     double[][] Vt,
                     int i_start,
                     int i_end,
                     boolean computeUV)
        Standard implicit shifted QR algorithm on B_hat which is the bottommost unreduced submatrix of B begin from i_start (inclusive) to i_end (inclusive).
        Parameters:
        s - diagonal elements
        e - superdiagonal elements
        Ut - left singular matrix
        Vt - right singular matrix
        i_start - start index of B_hat (inclusive)
        i_end - end index of B_hat (inclusive)
        computeUV - if U and V are to be computed

      • implicitZeroShiftQR

                       double[][] Ut,

                       int i_start,
                       int i_end,
                       boolean computeUV)
        Implicit zero-shift QR algorithm on B_hat which is the bottommost unreduced submatrix of B begin from i_start (inclusive) to i_end (inclusive).
        Parameters:
        s - diagonal elements
        e - superdiagonal elements
        Ut - left singular matrix
        Vt - right singular matrix
        i_start - start index of B_hat (inclusive)
        i_end - end index of B_hat (inclusive)
        computeUV - if U and V are to be computed

      • update

        private static void update(double cs,
          double sn,
          double[] V1,
          double[] V2)
        Update two 1D double arrays V1 and V2 by Givens rotation parameterized by cs and sn, i.e. [V1 V2] * |cs -sn| or |cs sn| * |V1'| |sn cs| |-sn cs| |V2'|
        Parameters:
        cs - cos(theta)
        sn - sin(theta)
        V1 - a 1D double arrays
        V2 - a 1D double arrays

      • bidiagonalize

        private static Matrix[] bidiagonalize(Matrix A)
        Bidiagonalize a matrix A, i.e. A = U * B * V' such that U and V are orthogonal matrices and B is a bidiagonal matrix.
        Parameters:
        A - a dense or sparse matrix
        Returns:
        a Matrix array [U, B, V]

      • bidiagonalize

        private static Matrix[] bidiagonalize(Matrix A,
                     boolean computeUV)
        Bidiagonalize a matrix A, i.e. A = U * B * V' such that U and V are orthogonal matrices and B is a bidiagonal matrix.
        Parameters:
        A - a dense or sparse matrix
        computeUV - if U and V are to be computed
        Returns:
        a Matrix array [U, B, V]

      • unpack

        private static Matrix[] unpack(Matrix A,
              double[] d,
              double[] e,
              boolean computeUV)
        Unpack U, B, and V from the result of bidiagonalization.
        Parameters:
        A - bidiagonalization result
        d - diagonal
        e - superdiagonal
        computeUV - if U and V are to be computed
